channel.title: Harvest Moon
channel.description:
Anyone ever played this series?
My all time favorite game next to Final Fantasy 8.
I first started with Back To Nature on the Playstation. Me and my best friend played it like every night for three whole summers. Starting over each summer to see how far we could get.
I got the GBA Friends Of Mineral Town version which turned out to be the exact same game with a couple new features.
I just downloaded the ROM of Island of Happiness, the newest DS version. I also ordered one of the flash cartridges where you can put ROMs on them and play them on the DS. So I'll move that and all the other HM games for the DS onto it to play on my way to school.
This game is probably the main reason why I want to garden.
Anyways. If you have played. Discuss why you did (or didn't) like it. If you haven't. Get a GBA emulator and the HM:FoMT ROM for it and try it out.
It's a cool game and it has tons of re-playability.

item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

sanga282:

im trying to play it on a PS2 emu but am having trouble getting a PS2 BIOS

PS2 or PS1 version?

PS1 BIOSs were easy to get.
Can you get them if you have a PS2?

I could send you one if I knew how to get it off my PS2

item.title: Harvest Moon
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

How is Rune Factory? I’ve always wanted to try it, but I felt it was too far away from the Harvest Moon I love.

So within the time of this topic, I have gotten and been playing Harvest Moon: Island of Happiness for the DS.

I love it!
I’m already in Fall of the first year. Seems to go by a lot faster than the other games.

I remember playing it every night for a whole summer and barely getting to the third year.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @WhiteShadow WhiteShadow

@WhiteShadow wrote:

I loved this Harvest Moon for the PS2 when I was in 5th/6th grade.

Sometimes I would whack the cows and horses… but they would never die… >[

item.title: Harvest Moon
item.dc:creator: @llib llib
item.description:
@llib wrote:

Good to know I’m not the only person that has been addicted to this game =P

Been playing them since I randomly rented the n64 version once not even knowing what the game was really about.

I also have the Ds version…Rune Factory? Still don’t get what makes HM addicting…

Read full topic

item.title: Harvest Moon
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

[quote=“jme, post:10, topic:262963”]I own save the homeland, for ps2.

My grandma bought it for me a long time ago. I wasn’t too excited about it, but I got addicted to it after a while and beat the game in several ways. Theres 9 ways to beat it. I kind of liked it =/[/quote]

It was kinda one of those games where if you’ve been a HM fan for a while, you won’t like it. But if it’s your first HM game, you might.

Kinda like people who read books don’t like the movies made out of them and people who see the movie first do.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

PS2 version Save The Homeland was the WORST. Oh my god I felt like throwing up playing that. What a disappointment =[

I always wanted the Gamecube version. Heard it was really good. Never got a gamecube though.

The DS versions are said to be a mix of the PS1 and GC versions. So =]

item.title: Harvest Moon
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

I have the GameCube version, Harvest Moon: A wonderful life.

It’s really a great game. I spent many many hours on it, had bought every building and had all star cows. The digsite and star milk really pays off.

I had around a million dollars(or whatever they are called on there, I forgot), and it really was a fun game. Thanks for reminding me about it, I am going to go play it soon

Read full topic
